settings.text: We offer full-spectrum, evidence-based doula services that support families through pregnancy, childbirth, and postpartum.

settings.heading: Doula Care for a Confident and Empowered Birth

settings.text:
For many women, the idea of giving birth can be a source of fear, anxiety, and doubt.

At Cliffrose Doula Care, we believe that every woman deserves to feel empowered and confident throughout the birthing process.

That's why we offer a range of classes and resources designed to provide you with the tools you need to achieve a beautiful and empowering birth and postpartum experience. Don't leave your birth to chance – join us today and take the first step towards a more positive and fulfilling birth experience.

Book a consultation

settings.title: Doula Care for a Confident and Empowered Birth
settings.text:
For many women, the idea of giving birth can be a source of fear, anxiety, and doubt.

At Cliffrose Doula Care, we believe that every woman deserves to feel empowered and confident throughout the birthing process.

That's why we offer a range of classes and resources designed to provide you with the tools you need to achieve a beautiful and empowering birth and postpartum experience. Don't leave your birth to chance – join us today and take the first step towards a more positive and fulfilling birth experience.

settings.title: We help you prepare for childbirth

settings.text:
With knowledge comes power, and that's where Cliffrose Doula Care comes in.

Our comprehensive education and support will equip you with the tools and understanding you need to approach pregnancy, birth, and parenthood with confidence and empowerment. Learn how to trust your body, connect with your baby, and make informed decisions that align with your values and preferences.

Don't let fear hold you back from the beautiful reality of a fulfilling birth and parenthood journey.

settings.title: Confidence for a Joyful Pregnancy and Birth

settings.text:
We will plan visits together before your estimated due date. Over a couple of hours, we’ll build on our connection and get more comfortable. We’ll discuss your birth preferences to create a Birth Plan, have Labor Prep class to practice relaxation techniques, talk about comfort measures and labor positions, I’ll also give plenty of tips on laboring at home. Through a few visits you’ll get ready for the baby, answer all your questions, and ease concerns.

Wondering what we’ll be talking about? Here’s a Planning Checklist full of topics we can dive into.

Whether you choose to give birth at home, at a birthing center, or a hospital, I will be by your side throughout labor to provide encouragement, comfort, and information when questions arise.

Beginning at 37 weeks, I will be available 24/7 on call. After contacting me at onset of labor, I will be constantly available via phone, video call, and text to provide support as you labor at home or with you at your preferred delivery location through the duration of labor. You can call me for any question, no matter how big or small, anything you need your doula for.

I will remain with you in the immediate hours after your baby is born to assist in skin-to-skin bonding and feeding your baby. I will also arrange to visit with you once you are settled at home, to discuss your experience, give support at home, and see how life is with your new bundle.

Visits are arranged to meet you where you’re at and from the comfort of your home. I want to hear about how you’re adjusting to life with a baby, even if it’s tough stuff: your feelings, emotions and thoughts-good or bad. I will answer any questions you may have, visit with you, and provide resources and tips on infant feeding. I will also help you plan meals and give you a grocery list to make life a little easier. If possible, we can arrange contact-free drop off of what you need—support through community, a meal train, or good friends and family is vital in building your village.

I aim to provide support past the initial weeks with a newborn. Postpartum care is widely underrated and can be so helpful to new parents, those with toddlers or multiple children through simple acts of caring for the parent, while you care for your family.
I offer 24/7 scheduled support at the rate of $100/hour for the following services

settings.title: Overnight Doula
settings.text:
The most shared fear among new parents are the sleepless nights. It’s true, new babies can be night owls, but with the extra support of an overnight doula it can be the best bonding experience with your new baby.

Call me, text or video chat for help and encouragement with nighttime bottle feedings, initial lactation education, questions about pumping and milk storage—anything to help you and your baby find your rhythm.

settings.title: Adoption & Surrogacy
settings.text:
Are you building your family, but aren’t sure where to find the right resources? Deciding to adopt or have a surrogate carrier are both dig decisions. You deserve to walk into parenthood feeling empowered and ready.

We will have consultations to answer your questions and I can provide local resources such as milk donors, parent support groups, and suggest LGBTQIA+ providers. We can talk about your legal rights as parents. I provide birth support for surrogate carriers in addition to the intended parents.

settings.title: Miscarriage & Bereavement
settings.text:
Going through such a difficult time, that is often suffered alone and in silence, I walk with and support your family through the loss of your baby.

If that loss is through miscarriage, stillbirth, or a diagnosis that means the baby will not live long after being delivered, with gentle encouragement, we say hello and goodbye to your little one, honor their life, and I remain available for grief counseling thereafter via phone and video calls, texts, and email.

As a full spectrum doula, I work with all reproductive journeys: conception, adoption, surrogacy, pregnancy, labor, and birth. I am there in the postpartum and can help you through a termination process. I support people through every outcome.

Whether this is your first baby or you’re growing your family, you are not alone.

Make informed decisions about your birth, your body, and your baby.

Trainings, Mentorships + Certifications

  • BADT Full Spectrum Doula Certification (2021)
  • BADT Full Spectrum Doula Training (2020)
  • Lactation Management for Doulas (2019)
  • Gentle Mothering Volunteer Doula (2018-2019)
  • DONA Birth Doula Training (2017)

*Please note that I am not a medical professional and always advise you to check with your primary care provider before making any decisions.

settings.title: Doula Care for a Confident and Empowered Birth
settings.text:
We already know that having someone there for you, cheering you on, believing in your choices feels really, really good—but here’s some science to back it up…

  • Doulas are a form of pain relief—requests for pain medication goes down 10% with a doula present
  • Doulas boost self-confidence—15% increase in spontaneous birth and shorter labor by 45minutes on average
  • Doulas encourage advocacy + increase safety—34% fewer negative experiences

Having constant companionship equals better outcomes

settings.heading: Should I hire a doula?
settings.row_content:
Having a doula on your labor team can mean:

  • fewer medical interventions during labor (less likely to have any pain medication, continuous electronic fetal monitoring, epidurals, vacuum or forceps-assisted births, and Cesareans)
  • increased release of natural oxytocin
  • more attention or hands on support than is reasonable for one partner or labor nurse to provide over an extended period of time
  • shorter labor, by about 40 minutes!

*Research from Cochrane Database Syst Rev. 2017

settings.heading: What's the difference between Doulas and Midwives? Do doulas deliver babies?
settings.row_content: Doulas are birth professionals that can work alongside midwives and doctors alike. In hospitals, birth centers and homes, we do our work “from the hips up”, that is to say doulas are here for your mental, emotional, and physical support focusing only on the immediate needs of the birthing person and their chosen partner to aid in the labor process and postpartum.

settings.heading: What kind of births do you support? Do you only support natural births?
settings.row_content:
All births are natural!

Really, birth is a natural occurrence so we support any and every type of birth and birthing body. No matter if you want no drugs or all the drugs, we will be there cheering you on and celebrating your choices.

“I do not care what kind of birth you have… a home birth, scheduled cesarean, epidural hospital birth, or if you birth alone in the woods next to a baby deer. I care that you are supported in your choices, and that you were respected”

- January Harshe, Birth Without Fear

settings.heading: Do doulas have any breastfeeding or lactation training?
settings.row_content: Yes we do! Doulas receive lactation training and can assist in coaching, feeding positions, developing a good latch, nutritional information, using a pump and how to navigate a feeding schedule. Our training is focused on the immediate postpartum and setting up good feeding habits early, we also have a great reference list for lactation consultants if you would like extended assistance.

settings.heading: Should I have a doula if I have a partner?
settings.row_content:
We could never replace the connection between you and your partner.

Doulas do more than assist the birthing person through labor, we support the partner through encouragement and by helping them to feel they have all the tools, knowledge and strength to support you through the process and to take as active a role they feel comfortable with.

Your doula and partner will work together to form a birth team, wholly invested in making you comfortable and getting baby Earthside.

settings.heading: Is it really possible to birth without pain medication?
settings.row_content:
YES, YES, YES!

You absolutely are capable of having a medication-free labor and your doula will support you throughout the experience. 

There have been many studies that show continuous support leads to better labor outcomes. I highly recommend visiting my Evidence-Based Birth blog for numerous eye-opening reads.

Doulas themselves are a form of pain relief. Studies show the constant reassuring presence of a doula greatly reduces stress levels and clients are less likely to request pain medication. We also rely on many forms of homeopathic medicine that have been traditionally used by midwives for centuries; medicine that has practical use today! We trust in the wisdom of the women before us and do our research to find medication-free pain relief that is safe, effective, and reliable.

settings.text: We believe strongly that everyone deserves a doula. No one will be turned away for lack of resources. Reach out and we can discuss how we can best support you best
